title: Eurovision 2023: Contest inspires Ukraine's LGBT troops
description: When Ukraine takes part in Eurovision on 13 May, its frontline LGBT troops will be taking inspiration.

title: How taking it slow could help protect our money
description: A culture of instant buying, paying, and delivery brings convenience but could expose our finances to harm.

title: What Europe's royals could teach King Charles
description: A combative media, a colonial past and rebellious children. Can other royal families help the UK's new monarch?

title: The enduring call of Local Hero 40 years on
description: The village of Pennan and its red phone box were made famous by the classic 1983 Bill Forsyth movie.

title: Walrus Freya killed by Norway gets Oslo sculpture
description: The animal was a popular attraction, but euthanised in August out of public safety concerns.

title: Thailand: Southeast Asia's 'weed wonderland'
description: Business booms in a free-for-all industry less than a year after Thailand legalised cannabis.

title: Coronation: Public asked to swear allegiance to King Charles
description: The pledge is among several changes to the service, which will incorporate female clergy and other faiths.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: Scotland 36-10 Ireland - Scots finish with back-to-back wins
description: A scintillating Fran McGhie try propels Scotland to back-to-back Women's Six Nations victories as they consign Ireland to the wooden spoon.

title: Manchester United: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's bid values club higher than Sheikh Jassim offer
description: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's Ineos Group may have taken a significant step towards taking control of Manchester United after it emerged their bid put a higher value on the club than Sheikh Jassim's.

title: Turkey's President Erdogan back on campaign trail after illness
description: The Turkish leader holds a rally in the opposition stronghold of Izmir after falling ill on Tuesday.

title: Coronation Street actor Barbara Young dies in Cambridge aged 92
description: Young, who also starred in Last of the Summer Wine, was warm-hearted and brilliant, her family say.

title: Azerbaijan GP Analysis: George Russell rejects Max Verstappen's criticism
description: A defiant George Russell rejects Max Verstappen's criticisms after the pair collided at the start of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix sprint race

title: We can't stay in Sudan forever, says government minister
description: The government said the airlift has been "extremely successful" after 1,650 people were rescued.

title: England 64-0 France: George Williams and Ash Handley score hat-tricks in thumping win
description: New captain George Williams and Ash Handley both score hat-tricks as England overwhelm France 64-0 in Warrington.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: England reflect on Twickenham 'pinch-yourself moment'
description: England captain Marlie Packer sets her sights on bigger things after a record crowd sees her side win a Grand Slam at Twickenham.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023 results: Luca Brecel into final after stunning comeback win over Si Jiahui
description: Luca Brecel wins 11 frames in a row during the greatest-ever Crucible comeback to beat Si Jiahui 17-15 and reach the World Championship final.

title: Brentford 2-1 Nottingham Forest: Ivan Toney and Josh Dasilva cancel out Danilo opener
description: Nottingham Forest are stunned as a late Brentford fightback denies them precious points in their fight for Premier League survival.

title: Brighton 6-0 Wolves: Seagulls boost European ambitions with biggest-ever top-flight win
description: Brighton reignite their push for a place in Europe next season by recording their biggest-ever top-flight victory at the expense of woeful Wolves.

title: Women's Six Nations: England defeat France to win Grand Slam
description: England seal a Six Nations Grand Slam at Twickenham, holding on for a 38-33 victory against France.

title: Laura Kuenssberg: What could go right and wrong for parties in England's local elections?
description: Laura Kuenssberg asks what could go right and wrong for political parties at the polls next week.

title: Jeff Stelling: Broadcaster to leave Sky Sports and Soccer Saturday show at end of season
description: Broadcaster Jeff Stelling announces he will leave Sky Sports' flagship Soccer Saturday show next month.

title: Sudan crisis risks becoming a nightmare for the world - former PM Hamdok
description: Former PM Abdalla Hamdok says the Sudan conflict could become worse than the wars in Syria and Libya.

title: Gunman kills five, including child, at Texas home
description: Police in Cleveland, Texas are looking for the suspect, described as a Mexican man carrying a rifle.

title: Star Wars illustrator Matt Ferguson and the return of classic poster art
description: Matt Ferguson has gone from working at HMV to designing posters for the world's biggest films.

title: Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Sergio Perez overtakes Charles Leclerc to win sprint race
description: Red Bull's Sergio Perez overtakes Ferrari's Charles Leclerc to win the sprint at the Azerbaijan Grand Prix.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: England 38-33 France
description: England seal a Six Nations Grand Slam in front of a record women's crowd of 58,498 at Twickenham.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: England captain Marlie Packer scores against France
description: Watch as England captain Marlie Packer scores a second try for the hosts against France in the Women's Six Nations Grand Slam decider at Twickenham.

title: Barack Obama and friends surprise Barcelona restaurant
description: Bruce Springsteen and Steven Spielberg joined the ex-US president for dinner in the Catalan capital.

title: Strike staffing offered to Great Ormond St children's hospital
description: The world-renowned children's hospital has "serious" concerns over this weekend's nurses' strike.

title: Quit your Ofsted roles, Perry's sister tells heads
description: Prof Waters says a "terrible injustice" had been done to her sister and now wants radical reform.

title: Sudan family reunite: 'No words can describe this moment'
description: Muammar Ali sees his three-month old baby daughter, Wahaj, for the first time, as his family joins him in the UK from Sudan.

title: Richard Sharp: PM should not appoint BBC chair, says David Dimbleby
description: The veteran broadcaster calls for a "cross party" public commission to ensure the BBC's balance.

title: Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Leclerc takes sprint race pole position
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc makes it two pole positions in as many days by leading the new sprint shootout at the Azerbaijan Grand Prix.

title: Ukraine war: Crimea oil tank set ablaze by reported drone
description: Flames engulf the facility in Russian-held Sevastopol, a day after a wave of strikes across Ukraine.

title: The aurora hunters chasing the perfect pictures of the Northern Lights
description: Photographers speak about their quests to capture the beauty of the Northern Lights.

title: North Korea warns of serious danger over US-South Korea deterrence deal
description: Kim Jong-un's sister says the pact to counter Pyongyang's nuclear threat will lead to a "more serious danger".

title: Royal Navy investigates after official documents 'found in Wetherspoons'
description: Documents marked "official sensitive" were reportedly found in a pub toilet in Barrow, Cumbria.

title: Sudan crisis: NHS doctors told they can catch last UK evacuation flights
description: The UK's final evacuation flights out of Sudan will take place later, as the latest ceasefire breaks down.

title: Why US presidents skip British coronations
description: There will be one glaring absence among the dignitaries at King Charles' coronation: US President Joe Biden.

title: School set to take Ofsted to court over inspection
description: The head teacher of the Cambridge primary school says she was left feeling suicidal after Ofsted's visit.

title: Brazil's Lula recognises six new indigenous reserves
description: Mining is banned and logging restricted in a vast Amazon area and some other indigenous reserves.

title: SNP plays longer game in bid for Scottish independence
description: The party leadership believes support for independence needs to be higher to force another referendum.
